Author: 𝙊𝙞𝙣𝙠#3612
Content:
`because if the mining rewards are less, the hashrate will be less`
If the entire world and its currencies would be revolving around Komodo, that would be a reliable prediction.
However, if the rewards diminish, less coins will be sold on exchanges. If no other factors change, demand would be equal as before. Logic dictates that KMD price will rise.
Although rewards are lowered, it doesn't mean the value of the mining effort is lowered too. As long as the value of the rewards (especially in relation to other chains rewards) remains equal, the hashrate will not change. The cryptomarket will regulate the hashrate on the chain as it does now.

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
`why should code care about them at all? `
I can only point back to a comment I made a while back that you may or may not have seen (I forget when your role changed, so I'm not sure if you saw it or not):
The simplest answer is because we were told it did.
I came to Komodo because the #tradebots channel on slack was a misnomer.
I stayed because I thought I feked up my pool and node and couldn't figure out why it was telling me that my 3 br was 1200+
This was, at that time, a so often asked about thing that it was answered but in a way that was very much like "How do you not know this?"
That "added incentive", or "bonus", or whatever we call it in whatever context is most times the only thing that makes mining KMD not a straight loss (compared to mining any one of a dozen other chains) when you have any solid amount of hashpower.
tl:dr:
The code should care because we were told by the creator of the code that the code cares

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: miners get all the txfees. txfee is the sum of inputs - sum of outputs. rewards makes the inputs become larger, that is why you see negative txfee for rewards claims more than 0.0001

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the sum of inputs (+ accrued rewards) is there, even if you spend it or not

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you dont spend it, it becomes exactly like a larger than needed txfee, as that is what it is

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: miners get the blockreward and all txfees

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this is pretty built into the protocol, so changing it is not as simple as you think it is and there could well be some bugs in the implementation

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: all places that needs to know the sum of inputs value needs to now handle two cases, when it is spent and when it isnt spent

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but this info is not really available in all places of the validation

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not saying its not possible to do, but certainly not anything to slam out right after you just did the annual hardfork
